Digital Scholarship Pretend Site
  • Action Areas (for internal use)
    • Research Data Services
    • Developing Methods
    • Digital Open Access Publishing
    • Workflows
    • Team Development
    • Outreach and Education
    • Connecting to Collections

Develop outreach and educational approaches for each of the three major areas in Digital Scholarship that are appropriate for communities.

Describe and promote models for engagement that move from simple support to deep collaborative engagement

  • Create and share recommendations for when people fall outside project paramaters. For example, for digitizations in cases where Digital Penn says no
  • Share and promote a tiered model for supporting collaborative research projects.
  • Co-create memoranda of understanding for tiered Omeka, Scalar, & Mukurtu. As well as for development
  • Create a Memorum of Understanding / Charter for web data entry forms such as those we want to include statements about sunsetting for forms that have "expired," preferred platforms, suggestions for front-ends, and so on.

Develop workshops for training researchers/students/faculty in digital fluencies

  • Create workshops for faculty on moving from Idea to Grant proposal for Price Lab/ All the other ways faculty can get funding.
  • Digital Scholarship Sandbox Workshop Series
  • DMPTool outreach and training
  • R Learning club
  • Schol Comm workshop for early career and PhD students
  • Create and market a menu of workshops to offer faculty, students, librarians on demand

Raise awareness about DS partnership and service opportunities

  • Raise awareness internally and externally about what the library offers in data asset management
  • Create a web presence for DS describing programs and services
  • Promote open access fund
  • A "how did they make that" for Penn projects across the University

Create a calendar of Digital Scholarship events

  • Figure out, develop and publicize option for video publishing and streaming
  • Establish workflows and procedures for the creation of open access journals
  • Establish workflows and procedures for the creation of open educational resources, in collaboration with campus and library partners
  • Establish workflows and procedures in support of Orcid and Expertise

Enhance working relationships outside the library

  • Have Articles+ be able to grab ScholarlyCommons content.
  • Work towards integration between ScholarlyCommons and Symplectic Elements
  • Currently, Franklin pulls in some ScholarlyCommons URLs for ETDs, but those URLs lead to the ProQuest metadata records in ScholarlyCommons, not the publicly accessible URLs. Not very useful.
